title: B.6. User rights in GDB
change_summary: 2 changes detected: Rights system is mature and stable. Keycloak integration may have evolved with new import features or SSO improvements. Toggle behavior (GREEN/GREY/YELLOW) is unchanged.

blocks.title: User rights overview
blocks.content: User rights management enables admin users to grant or take away rights and privileges to other users.
blocks.original_content: User rights management enables admin users to grant or take away rights and privileges to other users.
blocks.explanation: The core purpose of user rights management has not changed.

blocks.title: a) User rights page layout
blocks.content: Click user button, select User management. Left side: list of registered users. Right side: rights granted to selected user.
blocks.original_content: Click user button, select User management. Left side: list of registered users. Right side: rights granted to selected user.
blocks.explanation: The user rights page layout (left side users, right side rights) is core GDB functionality.

blocks.title: Search existing user
blocks.content: Search an existing user from the list of registered users.
blocks.explanation: User search functionality has not changed.

blocks.title: Import user from CAS/Keycloak
blocks.content: Create a new user: Must be registered in CAS/KC first. Import by clicking icon next to search field, enter user ID. Users can be imported from CAS or Keycloak identity providers.
blocks.original_content: Create a new user: Must be registered in CAS/KC first. Import by clicking icon next to search field, enter user ID.
blocks.explanation: The CAS/Keycloak user import feature is documented and likely still works the same way. However, Keycloak integration may have evolved since July 2025 -- for example, there may be new import options, batch import capabilities, or changes to how Keycloak IDs are handled. The basic workflow (import from identity provider) is likely the same, but specific details should be verified.
blocks.screenshot_description: User import from CAS/Keycloak -- verify current import dialog and options

blocks.title: Rights columns and actions
blocks.content: Right side: rights - Resources (databases) in first column. Actions: Read, Create, Update, Publish, Delete, User rights. Toggles define actions per database.
blocks.original_content: Right side: rights - Resources (databases) in first column. Actions: Read, Create, Update, Publish, Delete, User rights. Toggles define actions per database.
blocks.explanation: The rights matrix with its 6 action types (Read, Create, Update, Publish, Delete, User rights) and per-database toggles is core GDB functionality.

blocks.title: Groups of databases
blocks.content: Groups of databases are listed under their group. Rights can be granted to group or specific database.
blocks.original_content: Groups of databases: Listed under their group. Rights can be granted to group or specific database.
blocks.explanation: Group-level rights management has not changed.

blocks.title: b) Database structure rights
blocks.content: Read (needs Data toggle on), Update (Save button appears), Publish (Publish button appears), Delete (Delete button appears).
blocks.original_content: Read (needs Data toggle on), Update (Save button appears), Publish (Publish button appears), Delete (Delete button appears).
blocks.explanation: Database structure rights with their associated UI indicators (buttons appearing) have not changed.

blocks.title: c) Data User rights (Generic)
blocks.content: Read, Update (Edit button per entry), Delete (Delete button per entry).
blocks.original_content: Read, Update (Edit button per entry), Delete (Delete button per entry).
blocks.explanation: Generic data rights with their per-entry action buttons have not changed.

blocks.title: d) Data User rights (field level restrictions)
blocks.content: Click 'restrictions' button. Grant read/update rights to specific columns or records matching filter conditions.
blocks.original_content: Click 'restrictions' button. Grant read/update rights to specific columns or records matching filter conditions.
blocks.explanation: Field-level restrictions (column-specific and filter-based record access) are an advanced rights feature that has not changed.

blocks.title: e) Toggle behavior rules
blocks.content: GREEN=fully authorised, GREY=not authorised, YELLOW=partially authorised. Parent GREEN=all children GREEN. Parent YELLOW=at least one child YELLOW or GREY. Parent GREY=all children GREY.
blocks.original_content: GREEN=fully authorised, GREY=not authorised, YELLOW=partially authorised. Parent GREEN=all children GREEN. Parent YELLOW=at least one child YELLOW or GREY. Parent GREY=all children GREY.
blocks.explanation: The three-color toggle system (GREEN/GREY/YELLOW) with its inheritance rules is a mature and stable feature of GDB user rights.

blocks.title: Keycloak integration evolution
blocks.content: Keycloak integration for user management may have evolved since July 2025, potentially including new SSO features, improved user synchronization, or changes to how user identities are managed across the platform.
blocks.explanation: Keycloak is the identity management system used by eRegistrations. While the basic import workflow is likely the same, Keycloak itself receives updates and the eRegistrations integration may have been enhanced. Any new Keycloak-related features or changes to the authentication/authorization workflow should be verified with the platform team.
blocks.screenshot_description: Verify if any new Keycloak-related features or settings have been added to the user rights page
